paper_title: Duality in Non-Abelian Algebra V. Homological diagram lemmas
abstract: Through abelian categories, homological lemmas for modules admit a self-dual treatment, where half of the proof of a lemma is sufficient to prove the full lemma. As remarked in the prequel of the present paper (`Duality in Non-Abelian Algebra IV'), there is a self-dual treatment of these lemmas even in the case of non-abelian categories of group-like structures. It is based on the axiomatic context of a `noetherian form' introduced in the same paper, which is a generalization of an abelian category that includes among its examples semi-abelian and Grandis exact categories, as well as many others. The aim of the present article is to expose the proofs of homological diagram lemmas in this general context.
